phrases: I am at the Jack New Year's party.
I want to take the top spot and grant your dream one day!
yume kanaeru made chousen wa tsuzuku
juunengo no mirai kagayaiteru sugata wa
koukai wa shinai jibun de egaita story
makenai to i am about to mune ni chikatta
yume no tochuu de meguriau deai to wakare
kimi ga oshietekureta bokudake ga motsu chikara
The fight does not end until I fulfill my dream
I wonder how far I have come now?
In ten years, I will be living the dream
It is the scenario I wrote for myself, so I will have no regrets
But life is not that easy, and it is full of obstacles
Still, I swear to myself that I will not ever back down
I have a dream that I absolutely want to achieve
So I fuel my passion until I succeed
There will be meetings and partings along the way
But I will simply believe in my strength that you have taught me
And rise back up again and again and again
Baby I trust you my friend
zetsubou ni fushita kokoro no sumi
tooriame no ato ni mitsuketa niji wo motte
me wo tojiru fly with me donna nagai yume mo
deaeta ano hi ni mita tsukiakari desaemo
In this world, every day is dull and full of nonsense
I cover my ears, trying to mute the noise
Why do people hurt each other?
on the recesses of my heart, fallen into despair
While carrying this pain in my chest,
can I really dream of tomorrow?
Remembering the rainbow I found after the rain,
I close my eyes; come fly with me into my dream
If I have you, who shines so strong
I can envision an everlasting rainbow
And even remember the moonlight that lit us the night we met
I can picture them... countless times
I search for the tricked feelings
I am at the Jack New Year's
I am at the Jack New Year's
I want to take the top spot
I want to take the top spot
We will have Hattori sit there.
He said he had some things to talk about, like the contract and the assistants.
Does it have something to do with the contract?
I have been with Jack since last year.
Miura will be supervising you two from now on.
You already have a place to work?
We got it from a relative who is a manga artist.
It is really cheap; about as much as the utility bills.
You could have rented a room with your signing bonus, but you have saved yourselves the trouble.
Do not be in such a rush.
First, we have to discuss the transfer.
Detective TRAP will be supervised by Miura, not me.
I am in charge of other serializations and also just took over One Piece.
It would not be a good idea just to hand off these two to someone else.
That is why he was assigned to this new project.
Even though we have been in this together until now...
Is there absolutely no way you can do it?
A little while ago, even a veteran author had their supervisor switched on them.
They protested to their editors, but were convinced eventually.
They probably would not even listen if new guys like you complained.
We will be in your care.
It is hard to keep a serialization going.
Miura, I will leave them to you.
It may not be unusual for this to happen, but...
You have got the wrong idea.
Yesterday, he was begging so desperately to be allowed to work on Ashirogi Muto, they got angry with him.
You would better show me a good manga!
You cannot do anything about an editor change, and getting used to one takes a while.
This is the reality of being a professional.
Also, it bothers me that supervisors are like lottery tickets; you could end up with a winner or a loser.
Hey now, am I a loser?
Let us combine our youthful spirits and go for it!
Our contractual salary is that high?
It is too much for you high schoolers.
If you needed a place to work, we would give you more money, but you guys already have one.
So you are not actually getting that amount.
Well then, your script payment is Y12,000 per page, with a 50 color page bonus.
But I heard it was Y9,000 for new authors.
No other magazine may publish your work.
We do not have the leisure to draw for another magazine!
Quite the opposite - since our annual contract is with you, I want to make sure it runs continuously for the whole year.
I will bring a proper contract next time, so you can sign it then.
There is also the problem of your assistants,
but I managed to get a pro named Ogawa.
But I do not have many new people, so I have got no other talented people to give you.
Do you have anyone you know who could help you?
Someone who dabbles in manga or something.
Having someone assist you with the inking and tone would help a lot.
I will find two young people with serious personalities.
Um, how much does it cost for an assistant?
A young assistant costs Y10,000 per day.
About Y160,000 per month working four days per week.
At the most, Ogawa would cost you Y380,000 per month.
These days, you can only pull people in with that kind of salary, so it cannot be helped.
It requires a high skill level, and he will direct and supervise the other assistants for you.
Also, assistants have expenses like travel and food.
Until it is published, we are in the red!
If it gets canceled before then, we will stay in the red!
Please do not talk about being in debt when we have just been serialized.
Let us see, is it alright if they stay over here?
There is only enough space in the next room to nap.
My uncle did a gag manga, so the assistants just went home the next day.
Your uncle was successful enough for assistants?
The author of that Super Hero Legend?!
That is why that poster's here!
So that work was born here!
I really loved it when I read it in middle school!
I am expecting even more from you now that I know your uncle is Kawaguchi Tarou!
The deadline is two weeks before Jack goes on sale.
In other words, two weeks before the Monday that the issue is released.
Ideally, we want the finished manuscript by the Friday before that.
The final deadline for TRAP is February 4th.
It really only has to be 25, but you wanted a bit more?
Yes, we will take care of it.
I would like you to turn that in as soon as possible.
I want to wait for the survey results for Volume 4 onwards, so we will not get into those yet.
Are you fine with the assistants starting at the beginning of the year?
He is going through this so fast.
We cannot have you lose to them!
Um... Hiramaru Kazuya of Otters 11 is new, like us, right?
What kind of person is he?
I have not met him yet, but according to the editorial department, he quit his job as a salary man to do manga.
It seems that at the age of 26, he suddenly quit his job and started drawing manga.
Without having read much manga before then, his first work got honorable mention in a monthly contest.
A genius on another level like Niizuma.
Great things are expected from him more than anyone else.
Otters is like a gag manga, and it has a different writing style.
Besides, there is no use comparing different manga with each other!
All that matters is that yours is good.
We will give it our all!
You are going to flare up and burn out!
Um, we do not want to burn out...
Ah, that was a slip of the tongue.
Is he a winner or loser?
He does not seem like a bad guy.
January 17th is the New Year's party.
If authors do not attend without a good reason, the editors in charge of them will not have it easy!
It is not a problem of being nervous!
Anyway, a car will be coming to pick you up.
A car's picking you up, huh?
Serialized manga authors are pretty amazing.
Today's our meeting with the assistants.
You would calm down if a girl was there!
There will only be men working today; five of them.
It will be different from before.
This is the chief assistant, Ogawa.
It is an honor to meet you!
I will be in your care.
You did not say anything about a girl coming!
Kato only lives 3 train stops from here.
She will not be staying the night.
And she has a year of experience as an assistant in both shoujo and shounen manga.
You will not find another person with that much experience!
You will get distracted if there is a girl here?
Should we get Miyoshi to do the inking?
Of the people under me, he is the best at drawing.
He works fast and has unlimited potential as an assistant.
Does not that mean he has no experience?
The copier is old, but it looks like it will be fine.
Sensei, where is the computer and printer?
We do not have one here.
There are quite a few reference books here,
but it is best for Detective TRAP's backgrounds to be realistic.
I would like to take pictures of scenery with a digital camera, edit and trace them here.
I will arrange it right away.
Oh, you already have a penned-in manuscript.
Then, matching their art, draw other characters.
So this is a pro assistant!
Are you weak at drawing right-facing faces?
Yes, I sketch them in reverse.
Regardless of that, look at the whole manuscript in reverse and check for deviances.
Though you are good at it, a little discrepancy stands out.
I will do most of the backgrounds and spread the work among the three of us.
And I will leave the characters to Takahama.
Finishing will be done by the person with less work.
Miura, if the first volume is 54 pages, and the second is 27,
we should turn this in soon.
You look like a salary man.
They said to come in everyday clothes.
Do not you think it is rude to greet the authors without wearing appropriate clothes?
I will be assisting you today.
I am Tanaka from Metropolitan Transportation.
He is already been waiting for 15 minutes?
He said he got here early to avoid being late!
I feel bad for making him wait, so let us hurry up!
If we leave now, we will get there 40 minutes early.
But I can arrange for us to arrive at a more suitable time.
W-Well then, we would like to arrive 15 minutes early.
Being driven around like this makes me feel extra nervous.
That is right, I need to practice.
My name is Takagi of the pair of authors under the name Ashirogi Muto,
creators of the manga Detective TRAP which will begin serialization in February.
It is a pleasure to meet you.
Is not it kind of long?
I can just finish with I am Mashiro.
No way, it is not my thing.
What is with this gathering of suspicious black cars?!
If you have any belongings, you may leave them in the cloak room.
Please take this number card with you.
I feel kind of out of place.
If your serialization continues, you will come here every year!
Have a belated Happy New Year!
He is in his usual sweats!
Was there an editor who looked like that?
That is my new friend, Hiramaru.
He is the genius who may even be better than Eiji!
Is it alright to bring friends to the New Year's party?
The artist and writer of Ashirogi Muto.
There are a lot of young manga authors.
At any rate, I have come to a pretty strange place.
There is a lot of delicious food.
It is like I took a wrong turn.
Not on the highway, but in life.
There is no way I can be a manga author.
Did not you want to become a manga author?
For a moment I did think that.
I was briefly possessed by the idea, you might say.
One day, when I was tired of going to work, I picked up an edition of Jack and thought I could do it, too.
Jeez, what the hell was I doing?
He thinks he screwed up even though he was serialized?
Then what did you want to do?
I just did not want to work.
But now I have got a monthly serialization.
Why do people have to work?
I just want to sleep and eat.
I should have been born as a panda in a zoo!
Oh, is that why it is called Otter 11 ?
Subconsciously, I think the otter in the aquarium is better off than a human.
He is the one who flattered me by saying You have talent and You are a genius!
let us talk about the problem spots in the third volume...
Do you think it is good to be alive?!
Alright, let us go with that.
The catchphrase of your third volume...
Hiramaru is kind of weird and interesting.
It is about to start, so come up to the front...
Uh, we were just hit by Hiramaru's bad mood.
Speaking of which, he did say serialization was impossible.
Well, there are certainly people who are uncertain when they get serialized so suddenly.
But once you start up, it will all work out.
Thank you all for taking time out of your busy schedules to come here.
Thank you for allowing me to be your host for this New Year's party.
My name is Aida Soichi, and I work in Shounen Jack's editorial department.
Let us pretend to drink it.
First of all, let us have a few words from Mr. Torishima of the Board of Directors.
That is who Arare-chan's Mashirito and S uper Hero Legend's Torishiman are based on!
Torishima was a model for chief editors while I was working there.
I was happy when he came up to me at the New Years party, asked Who said you could put me in there?!, and strangled me.
And now I am at the same New Year's party.
I would like to ask Akimoto to lead the toast on behalf of all the authors.
I am going to eat a lot.
Oh, there is delicious-looking stuff over there too!
My Baked Cheese manga is getting serialized the volume before yours.
You are high schoolers, I hear?
Ah, I was just thinking of taking them around to meet everyone.
Oishi, can I talk to you for a minute?
The special prize right off the bat!
It is perfect, since the TV in our workplace is still analog.
Being a manga author really is about hard work, self-confidence, and luck!
More like hard work, conceit, and luck.
But maybe we have used up our luck with this.
Do not say things like that.
I hear you will not give the go ahead for an anime yet?
Yuujirou said that an anime will catch up to the manga soon, so I should not do it.
Niizuma, will you give me your autograph?
One of my relatives is a fan.
Who should I make it out to?
Niizuma Eiji looks like he is having fun.
Is he delaying an anime adaptation?
He is already become a real, serious manga author.
I want to be able to come here every year.
Yeah, we will definitely come back.
For that, you need to work hard on your serialization.
Have you gotten a bit used to it?
The people here are really charismatic, and we got a bit overwhelmed.
If you like, there is an after party, and an after-after party!
This is the only one high schoolers should attend.
Do not give them undue temptations.
What happened to him was a shame.
As someone who worked with him, I can only feel regret.
He was a man with guts.
You could say that backfired on him.
I am glad to have the opportunity to serialize people like you two.
I would like to do the things my uncle could not do, and the things he left undone.
What he could not do was make a living off of manga alone.
What he left undone was getting first place in the survey!
The best chance of getting first place in the survey is in the first year of serialization.
Popular manga authors want to get the top spot and have a long-running series.
No matter how long it takes.
Rather than thinking that, you think the possibilities are infinite.
Instead of thinking I would like to make that a reality, you think By my actions, I will make it a reality.
I heard that from some movie.
Though the party is in full swing,
unfortunately it is about time to wrap things up.
We reserved the hall for a short time...
I am sending a text to Azuki...
So I do not forget the determination I had today!
Our serialization is about to start, but...
Azuki, why did you send that text?
Next time, Anthologies and Photo Albums
Which is more important, dreams or reality?
